01650 #ifdef DEBUG
01651         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK [work=PROCESS_URB handle=0x%016llx]\n", (u64)(unsigned long)urbp->urb);
01652 #endif
01653         dump_urb(urbp->urb);
01654         list_move_tail(&urbp->urbp_list, &vhc->urbp_list_fetched);
01655         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01656         return 0;
01657 
01658     invalid_urb:
01659         // reject invalid urbs immediately
01660 #ifdef DEBUG
01661         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK  <<< THROWING AWAY INVALID URB >>>  [handle=0x%016llx]\n", (u64)(unsigned long)urbp->urb);
01662 #endif
01663         maybe_set_status(urbp, -EPIPE);
01664         vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01665         goto repeat;
01666     }
01667 
01668     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01669     return -ENODATA;
01670 }

00926     struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp;
00927     size_t size = 0;
00928     unsigned long flags;
00929     struct list_head *list;
00930 
00931     hcd = dev_get_drvdata(dev);
00932     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
00933 
00934     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
00935 
00936     if(attr == &dev_attr_urbs_inbox)
00937         list = &vhc->urbp_list_inbox;
00938     else if(attr == &dev_attr_urbs_fetched)
00939         list = &vhc->urbp_list_fetched;
00940     else if(attr == &dev_attr_urbs_cancel)
00941         list = &vhc->urbp_list_cancel;
00942     else if(attr == &dev_attr_urbs_canceling)
00943         list = &vhc->urbp_list_canceling;
00944     else
00945     {
00946         dev_err(vhci_dev(vhc), "unreachable code reached... wtf?\n");
00947         return -EINVAL;
00948     }
00949 
00950     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
00951     list_for_each_entry(urbp, list, urbp_list)
00952     {
00953         size_t temp;
00954 
00955         temp = PAGE_SIZE - size;
00956         if(unlikely(temp <= 0)) break;
00957 
00958         temp = show_urb(buf, temp, urbp->urb);
00959         buf += temp;
00960         size += temp;
00961     }
00962     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
00963 
00964     return size;
00965 }

static int vhci_hub_control ( struct usb_hcd *  hcd,
u16  typeReq,
u16  wValue,
u16  wIndex,
char *  buf,
u16  wLength 
) [static]

Definition at line 442 of file usb-vhci-hcd.c.

References debug_output, hcd_to_vhci(), hub_descriptor(), vhci::lock, vhci_port::port_change, vhci::port_count, vhci_port::port_flags, vhci_port::port_status, vhci::ports, trace_function, USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE, USB_PORT_STAT_C_OVERCURRENT, USB_PORT_STAT_C_SUSPEND, USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION, USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE, USB_PORT_STAT_HIGH_SPEED, USB_PORT_STAT_LOW_SPEED, USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT, USB_PORT_STAT_POWER, USB_PORT_STAT_RESET, USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND, USB_VHCI_IOC_PORT_STAT_FLAGS_RESUMING, userspace_needs_port_update(), and vhci_dev().

00448 {
00449     struct vhci *vhc;
00450     int retval = 0;
00451     unsigned long flags;
00452     u16 *ps, *pc;
00453     u8 *pf;
00454     u8 port, has_changes = 0;
00455 
00456     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
00457 
00458     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
00459 
00460     if(unlikely(!test_bit(HCD_FLAG_HW_ACCESSIBLE, &hcd->flags)))
00461         return -ETIMEDOUT;
00462 
00463     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
00464 
00465     switch(typeReq)
00466     {
00467     case ClearHubFeature:
00468     case SetHubFeature:
00469 #ifdef DEBUG
00470         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: %sHubFeature [wValue=0x%04x]\n", __FUNCTION__, (typeReq == ClearHubFeature) ? "Clear" : "Set", (int)wValue);
00471 #endif
00472         if(unlikely(wIndex || wLength || (wValue != C_HUB_LOCAL_POWER && wValue != C_HUB_OVER_CURRENT)))
00473             goto err;
00474         break;
00475     case ClearPortFeature:
00476 #ifdef DEBUG
00477         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: ClearPortFeature [wValue=0x%04x, wIndex=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wValue, (int)wIndex);
00478 #endif
00479         if(unlikely(!wIndex || wIndex > vhc->port_count || wLength))
00480             goto err;
00481         ps = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status;
00482         pc = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change;
00483         pf = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_flags;
00484         switch(wValue)
00485         {
00486         case USB_PORT_FEAT_SUSPEND:
00487             // (see USB 2.0 spec section 11.5 and 11.24.2.7.1.3)
00488             if(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND)
00489             {
00490 #ifdef DEBUG
00491                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d resuming\n", (int)wIndex);
00492 #endif
00493                 *pf |= USB_VHCI_IOC_PORT_STAT_FLAGS_RESUMING;
00494                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00495             }
00496             break;
00497         case USB_PORT_FEAT_POWER:
00498             // (see USB 2.0 spec section 11.11 and 11.24.2.7.1.6)
00499             if(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_POWER)
00500             {
00501 #ifdef DEBUG
00502                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d power-off\n", (int)wIndex);
00503 #endif
00504                 // clear all status bits except overcurrent (see USB 2.0 spec section 11.24.2.7.1)
00505                 *ps &= USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT;
00506                 // clear all change bits except overcurrent (see USB 2.0 spec section 11.24.2.7.2)
00507                 *pc &= USB_PORT_STAT_C_OVERCURRENT;
00508                 // clear resuming flag
00509                 *pf &= ~USB_VHCI_IOC_PORT_STAT_FLAGS_RESUMING;
00510                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00511             }
00512             break;
00513         case USB_PORT_FEAT_ENABLE:
00514             // (see USB 2.0 spec section 11.5.1.4 and 11.24.2.7.{1,2}.2)
00515             if(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE)
00516             {
00517 #ifdef DEBUG
00518                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d disabled\n", (int)wIndex);
00519 #endif
00520                 // clear enable and suspend bits (see section 11.24.2.7.1.{2,3})
00521                 *ps &= ~(USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE | USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND);
00522                 // i'm not quite sure if the suspend change bit should be cleared too (see section 11.24.2.7.2.{2,3})
00523                 *pc &= ~(USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE | USB_PORT_STAT_C_SUSPEND);
00524                 // clear resuming flag
00525                 *pf &= ~USB_VHCI_IOC_PORT_STAT_FLAGS_RESUMING;
00526                 // TODO: maybe we should clear the low/high speed bits here (section 11.24.2.7.1.{7,8})
00527                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00528             }
00529             break;
00530         case USB_PORT_FEAT_CONNECTION:
00531         case USB_PORT_FEAT_OVER_CURRENT:
00532         case USB_PORT_FEAT_RESET:
00533         case USB_PORT_FEAT_LOWSPEED:
00534         case USB_PORT_FEAT_HIGHSPEED:
00535         case USB_PORT_FEAT_INDICATOR:
00536             break; // no-op
00537         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_CONNECTION:
00538         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_ENABLE:
00539         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_SUSPEND:
00540         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_OVER_CURRENT:
00541         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_RESET:
00542             if(*pc & (1 << (wValue - 16)))
00543             {
00544                 *pc &= ~(1 << (wValue - 16));
00545                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00546             }
00547             break;
00548         //case USB_PORT_FEAT_TEST:
00549         default:
00550             goto err;
00551         }
00552         break;
00553     case GetHubDescriptor:
00554 #ifdef DEBUG
00555         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: GetHubDescriptor [wValue=0x%04x, wLength=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wValue, (int)wLength);
00556 #endif
00557         if(unlikely(wIndex))
00558             goto err;
00559         hub_descriptor(vhc, buf, wLength);
00560         break;
00561     case GetHubStatus:
00562 #ifdef DEBUG
00563         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: GetHubStatus\n", __FUNCTION__);
00564 #endif
00565         if(unlikely(wValue || wIndex || wLength != 4))
00566             goto err;
00567         buf[0] = buf[1] = buf[2] = buf[3] = 0;
00568         break;
00569     case GetPortStatus:
00570 #ifdef DEBUG
00571         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: GetPortStatus [wIndex=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wIndex);
00572 #endif
00573         if(unlikely(wValue || !wIndex || wIndex > vhc->port_count || wLength != 4))
00574             goto err;
00575 #ifdef DEBUG
00576         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: ==> [port_status=0x%04x] [port_change=0x%04x]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status, (int)vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change);
00577 #endif
00578         buf[0] = (u8)vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status;
00579         buf[1] = (u8)(vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status >> 8);
00580         buf[2] = (u8)vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change;
00581         buf[3] = (u8)(vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change >> 8);
00582         break;
00583     case SetPortFeature:
00584 #ifdef DEBUG
00585         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: SetPortFeature [wValue=0x%04x, wIndex=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wValue, (int)wIndex);
00586 #endif
00587         if(unlikely(!wIndex || wIndex > vhc->port_count || wLength))
00588             goto err;
00589         ps = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status;
00590         pc = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change;
00591         pf = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_flags;
00592         switch(wValue)
00593         {
00594         case USB_PORT_FEAT_SUSPEND:
00595             // USB 2.0 spec section 11.24.2.7.1.3:
00596             //  "This bit can be set only if the port’s PORT_ENABLE bit is set and the hub receives
00597             //  a SetPortFeature(PORT_SUSPEND) request."
00598             // The spec also says that the suspend bit has to be cleared whenever the enable bit is cleared.
00599             // (see also section 11.5)
00600             if((*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE) && !(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND))
00601             {
00602 #ifdef DEBUG
00603                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d suspended\n", (int)wIndex);
00604 #endif
00605                 *ps |= USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND;
00606                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00607             }
00608             break;
00609         case USB_PORT_FEAT_POWER:
00610             // (see USB 2.0 spec section 11.11 and 11.24.2.7.1.6)
00611             if(!(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_POWER))
00612             {
00613 #ifdef DEBUG
00614                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d power-on\n", (int)wIndex);
00615 #endif
00616                 *ps |= USB_PORT_STAT_POWER;
00617                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00618             }
00619             break;
00620         case USB_PORT_FEAT_RESET:
00621             // (see USB 2.0 spec section 11.24.2.7.1.5)
00622             // initiate reset only if there is a device plugged into the port and if there isn't already a reset pending
00623             if((*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION) && !(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_RESET))
00624             {
00625 #ifdef DEBUG
00626                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d resetting\n", (int)wIndex);
00627 #endif
00628 
00629                 // keep the state of these bits and clear all others
00630                 *ps &= USB_PORT_STAT_POWER
00631                      | USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION
00632                      | USB_PORT_STAT_LOW_SPEED
00633                      | USB_PORT_STAT_HIGH_SPEED
00634                      | USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT;
00635 
00636                 *ps |= USB_PORT_STAT_RESET; // reset initiated
00637 
00638                 // clear resuming flag
00639                 *pf &= ~USB_VHCI_IOC_PORT_STAT_FLAGS_RESUMING;
00640 
00641                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00642             }
00643 #ifdef DEBUG
00644             else if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d reset not possible because of port_state=%04x\n", (int)wIndex, (int)*ps);
00645 #endif
00646             break;
00647         case USB_PORT_FEAT_CONNECTION:
00648         case USB_PORT_FEAT_OVER_CURRENT:
00649         case USB_PORT_FEAT_LOWSPEED:
00650         case USB_PORT_FEAT_HIGHSPEED:
00651         case USB_PORT_FEAT_INDICATOR:
00652             break; // no-op
00653         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_CONNECTION:
00654         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_ENABLE:
00655         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_SUSPEND:
00656         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_OVER_CURRENT:
00657         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_RESET:
00658             if(!(*pc & (1 << (wValue - 16))))
00659             {
00660                 *pc |= 1 << (wValue - 16);
00661                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00662             }
00663             break;
00664         //case USB_PORT_FEAT_ENABLE: // port can't be enabled without reseting (USB 2.0 spec section 11.24.2.7.1.2)
00665         //case USB_PORT_FEAT_TEST:
00666         default:
00667             goto err;
00668         }
00669         break;
00670     default:
00671 #ifdef DEBUG
00672         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: +++UNHANDLED_REQUEST+++ [req=0x%04x, v=0x%04x, i=0x%04x, l=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)typeReq, (int)wValue, (int)wIndex, (int)wLength);
00673 #endif
00674 err:
00675 #ifdef DEBUG
00676         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: STALL\n", __FUNCTION__);
00677 #endif
00678         // "protocol stall" on error
00679         retval = -EPIPE;
00680     }
00681 
00682     for(port = 0; port < vhc->port_count; port++)
00683         if(vhc->ports[port].port_change)
00684             has_changes = 1;
00685 
00686     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
00687 
00688     if(has_changes)
00689         usb_hcd_poll_rh_status(hcd);
00690     return retval;
00691 }
